summary: This document is an email from Jeffrey Epstein to Mary Erdoes and Jes Staley discussing the creation of an entity and the associated fee structure for transactions. Epstein outlines a proposed profit-sharing arrangement and emphasizes the confidentiality of the communication.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email discussing financial arrangements and responsibilities.

persons.name: Mary Erdoes
persons.context: Erdoes is one of the recipients of the email, involved in discussions about financial arrangements.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is another recipient of the email, included in the financial discussions.

connections.description: Epstein and Erdoes are discussing financial arrangements and responsibilities in a business context.
Epstein and Staley are involved in discussions regarding the creation of a financial entity and fee structures.
Both Erdoes and Staley are recipients of Epstein's email regarding financial arrangements.

keyFacts: The email discusses the creation of a financial entity and outlines a proposed fee structure for transactions.
Epstein suggests starting profit shares at 15% for him and 5% for the recipients, proposing to settle at 10%.
The communication is marked as confidential and may contain attorney-client privileged information.
The email emphasizes the prohibition of unauthorized use, disclosure, or copying of the communication.
There are references to JPMorgan Chase in the context of financial arrangements.
